data.name: Unearthed Arcana 2023: Bastions And Cantrips
entries: This playtest document presents material designed for the 2024 version of the core rulebooks. The material here uses the rules in the 2014 core rulebooks, except where noted.
While the public playtest for the {@i Player's Handbook} continues, we want to give you this early taste of material slated for the revised {@i Dungeon Master's Guide}.

entries.name: Learn More on YouTube
entries: To learn more about the design in this article, we invite you to view the videos about it on YouTube ({@link www.youtube.com/DNDWizards}).

entries.name: What's Inside
entries: This article has two sections:

items.name: Bastions
entries: The bulk of this article introduces a new subsystem for Bastions. It includes everything you need to introduce Bastions to your game.

items.name: Cantrips
entries: A section at the end of this article presents several revised cantrips.

entries.name: This Is Playtest Material
entries: This article is presented for playtesting and feedback. The options here are experimental and in draft form. They aren't officially part of the game. Your feedback will help determine whether we adopt them as official.

entries.name: How to Playtest This UA
entries: We invite you to try out this material in play. When you do so, you can use characters created using the {@book 2014 Player's Handbook|PHB} or ones made with the "Player's Handbook Playtest" series, starting with "{@loader Character Origins.|collection/Unearthed Arcana 2022 - Character Origins.json|prerelease}"

To play with this material, you may either incorporate it into your campaign or run one or more special playtest sessions. For a session testing the Bastion rules, you don't need an adventure prepared; just focus on creating Bastions and resolving Bastion turns. For testing the cantrips, you may create an adventure of your own or use a short adventure from a source like {@adventure Keys from the Golden Vault|KftGV}, {@adventure Journeys through the Radiant Citadel|JttRC}, or {@adventure Candlekeep Mysteries|CM}.

entries.name: Feedback
entries: The best way for you to give us feedback on this material is in the survey we'll release on D&D Beyond. If we make this material official, it will be refined based on your feedback, and then it will appear in a D&D book.
Providing feedback on this document is one way you can help shape the next generation of D&D!

data.name: Revised Cantrips
entries: This section presents revised spells to playtest.

entries.name: Class Tags
entries: A spell's description contains one or more tags indicating the class spell lists that contain the spell. For example, if a spell has the "Wizard" tag, the spell is on the Wizard spell list.

entries.name: Spell Descriptions
entries: The following spells are presented in alphabetical order.

entries.name: Design Note: Spell Updates
entries: Here are the main updates to the spells in this section:

items.name: Acid Splash
entries: now creates a 5-foot-radius sphere that can affect any creature caught in it, and it is an Evocation instead of a Conjuration spell. The school change unites this spell with the Sorcerer and Wizard's other direct-damage Acid spells.

items.name: Blade Ward
entries: is now a Reaction that imposes Disadvantage on a creature's melee attack roll.

items.name: Chill Touch
entries: is now a touch spell that deals {@damage 1d10} damage rather than {@damage 1d8}, and it no longer has the rarely used Undead-specific effect.

items.name: Friends
entries: now forces the target to make a save against being {@condition Charmed} briefly.

items.name: Poison Spray
entries: now has a range of 30 feet rather than 10 feet, and it uses an attack roll rather than a saving throw. Also, it is now a Necromancy rather than a Conjuration spell.

items.name: Produce Flame
entries: is now a Bonus Action, but the attack portion is still an action. The range of the light has increased to 20 feet, and the range of the attack has increased to 60 feet. Also, the attack can now target creatures or objects.

items.name: Shillelagh
entries: now improves at higher levels, and it gives you the option of dealing Force damage or the weapon's normal type.

items.name: Shocking Grasp
entries: now shuts down {@action Opportunity Attack|PHB|Opportunity Attacks} rather than all Reactions. Shutting down all Reactions is too powerful for a cantrip. This cantrip has always been meant to provide a partial {@action Disengage}, which it still does in this version. Like other Lightning spells, the spell also no longer makes distinctions about whether the target is wearing metal.

items.name: Spare the Dying
entries: is now a ranged rather than a touch spell, and the range increases as you level up. The spell is now also on the Druid list.

items.name: True Strike
entries: is now an attack with a weapon that uses your spellcasting ability rather than Strength or Dexterity.
